posts.title: Gestalt February Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from February.

posts.title: TextField
posts.content: TextField now supports [all autocomplete](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete#values) prop values.

posts.title: Small component updates
posts.imageAltText: Image of RadioGroup with a Banner
posts.content:
Some component updates: 
- [RadioGroup](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/radiogroup#With-Badge) now supports Badges. 
- We deprecated 'red' [Popovers](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popover#Props)! 
- [TextField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textfield#Props) now supports dataTestId

posts.title: Banner it up!
posts.imageAltText: Light blue graphic with the words in navy blue: “Banner it up!
posts.content: Banner it up! Naming refresh: Callout is now [BannerCallout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/bannercallout), SlimBanner is now [BannerSlim](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/bannerslim), Upsell is now [BannerUpsell](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/bannerupsell), and UpsellOverlay (guess what?) is now [BannerOverlay](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/banneroverlay)

posts.title: Icons
posts.imageAltText: Visuals in black of the six new icons added to the Gestalt iconography collection
posts.content: [New icons](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library) available for you: collapse, expand, face-tryon, fade (for animation effects), speech-heart (for commenting), and clock-checked (for time indication)

posts.title: SearchGuide
posts.imageAltText: SearchGuides displayed on mobile
posts.content: New [iOS](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/searchguide) and [Android](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/searchguide) docs for SearchGuide.

posts.title: ButtonToggle
posts.imageAltText: ButtonToggle variants on Figma
posts.content: [ButtonToggle](https://www.figma.com/file/DlhmMWnyiYITbhfzZeqHaN/Gestalt-VR-Library?type=design&node-id=45%3A388&mode=design&t=qaRtVnZztRO1DVZF-1) specs added to Figma — docs are also available for [iOS](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/buttontoggle) and [Android](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/buttontoggle).

posts.title: Dark Mode updates
posts.imageAltText: Figma feature showing the option to switch between themes using variables
posts.content: Dark Mode variants (Figma) were deprecated. We will now rely on variables to switch between modes. New to variables? [Check out our mini-tutorial How to use variables](https://www.loom.com/share/b78e7ab541024753a0543c52ea9a4f8a?sid=b262b1e0-b639-42a7-ac4a-0da9b7b9a248)

posts.title: Gestalt January Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from January (& December!) .

posts.title: BannerOverlay & BannerUpsell
posts.imageAltText: Image of BannerOverlay
posts.content:
BannerOverlay is a new component for short floating  educational messages. [Learn more about BannerOverlay](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/banneroverlay). 

Also, Upsell was renamed to [BannerUpsell](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/bannerupsell)! More additions to the Banner family coming soon. Stay tuned!

posts.title: Support for denser Gestalt components
posts.imageAltText: Animated image changing List component sizing
posts.content: Denser layouts are supported with new small sizes for [Accordion](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/accordion) (previously named as Module), [SegmentedControl](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/segmentedcontrol), [List](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/list), [Textfield](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textfield), and [Tag](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tag).

posts.title: Default cursor pointer available in TapArea
posts.content: Use the 'default' cursor over non-interactive elements. The 'default' cursor should change to a pointer if the element it hovers over is also clickable or indicates functionally.

posts.title: New icons
posts.imageAltText: Full list of icons rendered
posts.content: We added a whole lot of new cross-platform icons to our [iconography collection](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library): scissors, clock, clock-checked, 360, alphabetical, arrow-counter-clockwise, arrow-up-left, arrows-vertical, camera-flip, chevron-up-circle, collapse, color-solid, color-split, expand, fade, face-tryon, file-box, forward, forward, insights-conversion, layout, lips, overlay-text-outline, rewind, service-dropbox, service-etsy, service-messenger, service-outlook, service-yahoo, service-youtube, share, shrink, skintone, spread, view-type-space, and x!

posts.title: Accordion
posts.imageAltText: Illustration of Gestalt’s accordion component
posts.content: The Module component is now called [Accordion](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/accordion) to better align with the industry standards naming convention.

posts.title: Density variants
posts.imageAltText: Density visual representation indicating different sizes and spaces
posts.content: Density variants for [SegmentedControl](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/segmentedcontrol), [Tag](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tag), and [Accordion](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/accordion) (web) are now live and available on [Figma](https://shorturl.at/oJKW3). Density variants are also available for [TextFields](https://www.figma.com/file/vjhfBsOtHw0wVg67vqwz1v/Gestalt-for-web?type=design&node-id=18773%3A32141&mode=design&t=AV2ifbXfwvcwwxYW-1) in Figma.

posts.title: BannerOverlay
posts.imageAltText: Illustration of Gestalt’s banner overlay component
posts.content: Our [BannerOverlay](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/banneroverlay) web component (former UpsellOverlay) is now code-ready for you! We changed the component name to better align with our message patterns, but don’t worry; the component function is still the same.

posts.title: Layout guidelines
posts.imageAltText: Layout graphics simulating a page structure
posts.content: [Layout guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/layout) are now live. Check it out!

posts.title: iOS Documentation updates
posts.imageAltText: Gestalt’s avatar group and icon floating button components representation
posts.content: iOS Documentation updates and Figma refinements on the following components: [Avatar](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/avatar), [Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/button), [ButtonGroup](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/buttongroup).

posts.title: New iOS Figma components
posts.imageAltText: Gestalt’s avatar group and icon floating button components representation
posts.content: Net-new Figma components and iOS docs for [AvatarGroup](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/avatargroup) and [IconFloatingButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/iconbuttonfloating).

posts.title: New International Design guidelines
posts.imageAltText: International design graphic representation showing pluralization and number localization
posts.content: [Number localization](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/international_design/number_localization) and [Pluralization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/international_design/pluralization) are published under International Design.

posts.title: Icon fixes
posts.imageAltText: Directional-arrow-left, arrow-back and heart-outline Gestalt icons
posts.content: Fix on duplicated icons: directional-arrow-left, arrow-back and heart-outline.

posts.title: Gestalt November Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from November.

posts.title: More, better PDocs for Gestalt!
posts.content: Check our new PDocs sections: [Best practices for Flow typing Gestalt components](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/docs/gestalt-types#best-practices-for-flow-typing-gestalt-components), [CSS](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/docs/css), [accessibility](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/docs/accessibility), and [Gestalt metrics](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/docs/gestalt-metrics).

posts.title: Other component updates
posts.imageAltText: Image of the new icons
posts.content:
- **Status** supports new locked' status. 
 - **SideNavigation** supports controlled group display for collapsing/expanding groups. 
 - **Icons**. We added 4 new cross-platform icons to our [iconography collection](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library): captions, captoins-outlined, sticker, upload-feed.

posts.title: Color variables full rollout
posts.imageAltText: Examples of variables matching our library cover
posts.content: We migrated ALL of our components to use color variables instead of styles so that you can enable modes, meaning it is super easy to switch between light and dark modes without relying on extra variants. You can use variables in your files by enabling our [variables library](https://shorturl.at/cdknU) in your Figma files.

posts.title: More chart guidelines
posts.imageAltText: Line and Bar chart examples in geometric shapes'
posts.content: New [Bar graph](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/charts_and_graphs/bar_graphs) and [Line graph](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/charts_and_graphs/line_graphs) guidelines are available!

posts.title: Locked Status
posts.imageAltText: New lock icon and deprecated sunset icon
posts.content: [New status variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/status#Text-additions) for campaigns and workflows in a locked status. In addition, we deprecated the workflow-status-sunset icon as it isn’t part of our status component.

posts.title: DateField
posts.imageAltText: DateField component graphic
posts.content: [DateField component](https://shorturl.at/azGHT) added to the Figma web library.

posts.title: More iOS docs!
posts.imageAltText: iOS textArea component along the iOS apple logo
posts.content: New docs for [iOS TextArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/textarea)

posts.title: and more Figme web component improvements!
posts.imageAltText: Web library Figma cover
posts.content: We revamped our web components (Figma) to better match our web docs. Keep your Figma files updated with Gestalt’s libraries to get our latest fixes!

posts.title: Gestalt October Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from October.

posts.title: ChartGraph & tabular data
posts.imageAltText: Animation of Chart and tabular data modal
posts.content: ChartGraph supports tabular representation for accessibility [Check it out!](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/chartgraph#Tabular-representation)

posts.title: Docs: Localization & Experimentation
posts.imageAltText: Snapshot of ChartGraph localized to German
posts.content:
More Docs improvements! We standardized the Localization section in our web components. Inside the Localization section, you'll find information regarding DefaultLabelProvider as well as locale support. [Check it out!](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/chartgraph#Localization). 

  We also added an [Experimentation section](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/get_started/developers/contributing/experimentation) as guidalines for approved contributions.

posts.title: PDocs integrated into Gestalt Docs
posts.imageAltText: Image of the DOcs for ButtonLink and an arrow pointing to the PDocs link'
posts.content:
PDocs is now accessible from our Docs in our Internal documentation section. 

  In [PDocs](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/docs/gestalt-overview), we document Pinboard-specific implementations for Gestalt Providers, component extensions, and ads logging extensions. 

 Check [ButtonLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/buttonlink) to see an example of PDocs integrated in our Docs.

posts.title: Other component updates
posts.imageAltText: Image of the new icons
posts.content:
- **Link** finally supports dataTestId prop. In Pinboard, we also deprecated SterlingLink and added Link to the [adsLoggingExtension extension](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/docs/gestalt-ads-logging-extension#gestalt-components-with-ads-logging)

 - **Icons**. We added 6 new icons added to our [iconography collection](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library). They are: 
 **Cross-platform icons**: speech-outline, speech-exclamation-point 
 **Web-only icons** (campaign insights, media planing and measurement): api, data-source, hearth-health, diagnostics.

posts.title: RTL and international design guidelines
posts.imageAltText: Image of Buttons with RTL language
posts.content: RTL and international design guidelines are now available for you! [Check it out!](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/rtl_guidelines/about_international_design)

posts.title: iOS doc updates
posts.imageAltText: Image of IconButton UI'
posts.content: [iOS Badge](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/badge) and [iOS IconButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/iconbutton) docs are now available. Guidelines, best practices, accessibility and much more!

posts.title: ListAction updates
posts.imageAltText: Image of ListAction UI
posts.content: We updated our ListAction component to better support you. You can find it by checking our [iOS](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/listaction) and [Android](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/listaction) docs.

posts.title: New icons

posts.content:
We added 6 new icons added to our [iconography collection](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library). They are: 
- **Cross-platform icons**: speech-outline, speech-exclamation-point 
- **Web-only icons** (campaign insights, media planing and measurement): api, data-source, hearth-health, diagnostics

posts.title: Gestalt Eng September Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from September.

posts.title: ChartGraph
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of ChartGraph UI
posts.content: Another month, another new component — this time it's [ChartGraph](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/chartgraph)! This component is used for displaying various types of graphs plotted on an x and y axis.

posts.title: Button/ButtonLink, no more role='link'
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Button and ButtonLink UI'
posts.content: [Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/button), [IconButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbutton) and [TapArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/taparea) no longer support link behavior. Instead, use [ButtonLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/buttonlink), [IconButtonLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbuttonlink), and [TapAreaLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/taparealink).

posts.title: Tokens
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of spacing token UI'
posts.content: [Spacing token](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/design_tokens/overview#Spacing) values are changing to a new scale. This updates old and also adds new values. In order to maintain consistency with our Figma designs and offer more flexibility in spacing, we're using spacing on a 4pt scale.

posts.title: ListAction, our newest component 🎉
posts.imageAltText: Examples of the Figma ListAction component.
posts.content:
The ListAction component is now available on Figma! You can get it from our [iOS](https://www.figma.com/file/AHcKJDgb7E7YswlgW1wY8E/Gestalt-for-iOS?type=design&node-id=42153%3A2141&mode=design&t=S8yWhcY8h1QKnNUa-1) and [Android](https://www.figma.com/file/REw1COFYAktmVWrUBh3Ov8/Gestalt-for-Android?type=design&node-id=44003%3A2474&mode=design&t=o8AXWs5UvyUcOy2F-1) libraries 🙌

**Please note**: Table in iOS for Figma is being deprecated. We ask you to kindly update to ListAction.

posts.title: ListAction documentation is now available for you
posts.imageAltText: Example of the new ListAction component.
posts.content:
We have brand new docs for you. Meet the **ListAction** component!

The ListAction is a continuous vertical group of list items that can include text, icons, images, and actions.


* Go to [iOS](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/listaction) documentation


* Go to [Android](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/listaction) documentation

posts.title: New AvatarGroup documentation for Android
posts.imageAltText: AvatarGroup components examples
posts.content: In [this doc](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/avatargroup) you can find AvatarGroup best practices, variants, specs, and more!

posts.title: Handoff Kit updates
posts.imageAltText: Examples of the Figma Handoff Kit accessibility annotation components.
posts.content:
We made **refinements** in our **Handoff Kit library** to bettersupport you! 🙌

What changed:
* Assets are using color variables instead of styles, it will make it easier for you to switch between themes (light and dark mode)
* New accessibility annotations are available for you (keyboard navigation and error specs), plus, we added a section to explain how to use them
* **Did you know we have an accessibility checklist component for you?** We recommend you to use it to check if your design meets accessibility standards!
* Sizes and auto-layout issues were fixed

**Enable our [Handoff Kit library](https://www.figma.com/file/50RRYnFcgPTQzy1AIjQoWB/%5BLibrary%5D-Gestalt-Handoff-Kit?type=design&mode=design&t=742YdaAQSpoMySWA-0) in your files to use it all!**

posts.title: Toast updates
posts.imageAltText: Example of the new Toast component design.
posts.content:
The Toast component for iOS and Android now have the same smaller and slicker design and styling as web. It was also simplified, so a few variants have been deprecated and will be deleted on *09/31/2023*. 

**Our ask:** If you notice Toast doesn't show the new design after updating your file, please replace the component. Thank you!

posts.title: Icon updates
posts.imageAltText: A fill star icon, a hollow star icon and a half-filled star icon.
posts.content: Thanks to Amanda Peterson, we found inconsistenciesbetween star icons on web vs mobile, in addition to a missing outlined version of the star icon. They are now availablein our Figma Foundations library, [Web Github repo](https://github.com/pinterest/gestalt), Android Github repo and will soon be available in our iOS Github repo!

posts.title: Gestalt Eng August Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from August.

posts.title: TableOfContents
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of TableOfContents UI
posts.content: Another month, another new component — this time it's [TableOfContents](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tableofcontents)! This component enables users to navigate to anchors on a page. It also serves as an outline of a page’s content.

posts.title: TapAreaLink, IconButtonLink
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of IconButtonLink UI with a visit icon or an arrow to the top-right corner and a tooltip that reads 'Visit Pinterest!'
posts.content: Button, IconButton and TapArea can behave like buttons and links. Last month, we added ButtonLink to the library. This month, we just released [TapAreaLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/taparealink) and [IconButtonLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbuttonlink): these components are only links. Stay tunned, we'll be deprecating the `role` prop soon.

posts.title: Testing id support
posts.content: We are working on expanding support to data-test-id in our components. This improvement helps engineers building better tests: faster and more reliable. Check TapArea's, TapAreaLink's, and IconButtonLink's new `dataTestId` prop. You can also use the `name` prop in Button and IconButton to build [better testing queries](https://testing-library.com/docs/queries/about/#priority).

posts.title: Component updates: Text, Heading
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot breakAll in Text where the text string is justified
posts.content: [Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/text#Overflow-and-truncation) and [Heading](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/heading#Overflow-and-truncation) now support `breakAll` in the `overflow` prop.

posts.title: Docs updates
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of a Sandpack example
posts.content: Finally, ALL our component examples and live code editors use Sandpack! Sandpack provides a better documentation experience. Try it out!

digests.summary: New components and Figma updates, plus a very special announcement

posts.title: Generate Tables easily in Figma
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of the plug-in that shows how to creat a Table.
posts.content: We have added the ability to quickly create a Table in Figma via our [Pinterest Design plug-in](http://pinch.pinadmin.com/pinterest-design-plugin)

posts.title: Navigation for long pages and forms
posts.imageAltText: Example of the TableofContents component with a task list to navigate through.
posts.content: Our [TableofContents](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tableofcontents) component offers a simple way to jump between sections of a page or a long form. It has been available in Figma for a while, and is now in our codebase and ready to go.

posts.title: Link via a button
posts.imageAltText: A primary button with text and a visit link icon.
posts.content: Sometimes you want to use a stronger affordance to let people visit a helpful page or something. Now you can with [ButtonLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/buttonlink). It allows developers to use a button as a link without going through any extra work.

posts.title: Figma Module component fixes
posts.imageAltText: A Module with a panel showing that a max width has been added.
posts.content:
Our Figma component was having issues with text alignment. That has been fixed, and we've also added a max width to be more consistent with code and help with alignment.
 
[Go to the Figma Accordion component](http://pinch.pinadmin.com/accordion)

posts.title: Figma Popover update
posts.imageAltText: A popover with the caret being cut off by a pair of scissors.
posts.content:
The caret was removed from the Popover to be consistent with our web codebase. It also means you can now place the popover without having to worry about moving the caret around. Win win!
 
[Go to the Figma Popover component](http://pinch.pinadmin.com/popover)

posts.title: Save the Date! October 20 means Design Systems Day!
posts.imageAltText: A calendar icon with the Gestalt logo in the middle of it, surrounded by circle and square ornaments.
posts.content:
Save the Date! October 20 means Design Systems Day!* 
We are planning this year's Design Systems Day and can't wait to share all the details. We'll keep you posted as things are in finalized. It's going to be fabulous!

posts.title: Gestalt Eng July Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from July.

posts.title: DateRange
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of DateRange UI
posts.content: Another month, another new component — this time it's [DateRange](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/daterange)! This component enables users to select a date range in multiple ways: from a calendar, typing the date or choosing from a preselected range with RadioGroup.

posts.title: ButtonLink
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of ButtonLinmk UI with text Visit Pinterest and an icon with an upper arrow conveying that it's an external link
posts.content: Button, IconButton and TapArea can behave like buttons or links. We are going to start decoupling these two behaviors: Button will be a button and [ButtonLink](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/buttonlinks) will be only a link. Stay tunned to our progress!

posts.title: Testing id support
posts.content: We are working on expanding support to data-test-id in our components. This improvement helps engineers building better tests: faster and more reliable. Check Button's, ButtonLink's, and IconButton's new `dataTestId` prop. Stay tuned, there are more to come!

posts.title: Component updates: Box, Table, Popover, DateField, DatePicker
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of before and after in DateField showing new support to locale format translations. In Italian, placeholders was DD/MM/YYYY and now is GG/MM/AAAA
posts.content:
[Box](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/box#Using-'as'-property) now supports `

` in `as` prop. [Table.SortableHeaderCell](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/table#Sortable-header-cells) finally supports right aligment correctly. [Popover](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popover) no longer supports `showcaret` and `blue` in `color`. Use [PopoverEducational](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popovereducational) instead. However, Popover now supports `forceDown` in `idealDirection` for cases where Popover's positioning might cause issues. [DateField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datefield#localeData) now supports locale format translations. [DatePicker](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datepicker#Controlled-component) is finally a fully controlled component.

posts.title: Docs updates
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of the Known issues section within Popover's documentation page
posts.content: We added a new section in our component docs section: Known issues. Check the new information under Component quality checklist for [Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/text#Component-quality-checklist), [Heading](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/heading#Component-quality-checklist), [Popover](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popover#Component-quality-checklist), [PopoverEducational](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popovereducational#Component-quality-checklist), [Tooltip](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tooltip#Component-quality-checklist) or [DatePicker](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datepicker#Component-quality-checklist).

digests.summary: New/improved components, updated color tokens, docs improvements and Figma plugin feature enhancements.

posts.title: New DateRange component
posts.imageAltText: Example of the DateRange component.
posts.content:
New and fresh off the press is [DateRange](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/daterange). A component that, you guessed it, allows you to select a date range. DateRange is still in pilot status, meaning expect design/development iterations and breaking API changes.

We plan to publish the Figma DateRange component in next sprint, so stay tuned.

posts.title: Support for Text type in Callout component
posts.imageAltText: A Callout with bold and italicized text in its message.
posts.content: Callout's `message` prop now supports types of `string` and `Text` to enable rich text (e.g., bold, italic). This enables better emphasis of content with message strings and allows the component to work more consistently with its related [SlimBanner component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/slimbanner).

posts.title: End-aligned Table header treatments
posts.imageAltText: A table with an end-aligned table header.
posts.content: It's been a long-time ask to support end-aligned header treatments and we're excited to say it's now supported. End-aligned headers will be especially helpful for columns displaying numeric values.

posts.title: Updated $selected-strong and $selected-weak color token values
posts.imageAltText: Two color swatches that represent Gestalt's $selected-strong and $selected-weak color token values.
posts.content: The color values for $color-background-selected-strong and $color-background-selected-weak were inadvertently inverted according to our color guidelines. We were able to address that issue earlier this month. Apologies for the mixup!

posts.title: Docs improvements
posts.imageAltText: A screenshot of Gestalt's Android Badge component documentation.
posts.content:
We have loads of docs updates to share: 

 * We published [Android Badge documentation](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/badge) in preparation of component buildout.
* We continue to migrate our code samples to Sandpack, with [Column](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/column), [Label](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/label), [Letterbox](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/letterbox), [Masonry](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/masonry) and [Mask](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/mask) recently converted. 

  * Lastly, but not leastly, we overhauled our component status page to now be three pages ([Android](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/component_status), [iOS](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/component_status) and [Web](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/component_status)). There remains some content updates necessary related to Figma status, but our goal was to publish these new pages with up-to-date code component status for all platforms.

posts.title: New linter functionality in the Pinterest Design Figma plugin
posts.imageAltText: A screenshot of the Pinterest Design Figma plugin's linter feature.
posts.content: We shipped a big feature within the [Pinterest Design Figma plugin](https://www.figma.com/community/plugin/1215463263194174399) which helps you clean up your design files so that you're using color / type styles in your designs. This is important because by using Gestalt styles, any updates to color / type tokens will be automatically applied to your designs without having to manually update. Check it out!

posts.title: Gestalt Eng June Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from June.

posts.title: TagData
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of TagData UI
posts.content: Another month, another new data viz component — this time it's [TagData](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tagdata)! This component enables users to select multiple categories for comparison in a graph or chart.

posts.title: GlobalEventsHandlerProvider
posts.content: We also introduced [GlobalEventsHandlerProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/utilities/globaleventshandlerprovider), a new way to share global event handlers. This replaces the previous OnLinkNavigationProvider, but also does so much more. The other use case we currently support handles opening and closing a SheetMobile when Dropdown or Modal are used on a mobile device. We'll expand this in the future to support other use cases as well.

posts.title: Masonry 2-column module prototype
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Masonry UI showing 2-column module
posts.content: We've been working for a while to support [2-column modules within Masonry](https://github.com/pinterest/gestalt/pull/2955). In June we merged a prototype of that support! We'll continue to iterate on this prototype as we integrate it into Pinboard, and we hope to launch this as an experiment soon.

posts.title: Component updates: Callout, DefaultLabelProvider, SheetMobile
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Callout with a rich message
posts.content: [Callout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/callout#Message) now supports rich `message` text using our [Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/text) component. [SheetMobile](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/sheetmobile)'s `onOutsideClick` handler returns the event to match our convention and allow for more precise event handling. And we added a slew of new strings to [DefaultLabelProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/utilities/defaultlabelprovider#Default-strings-provided), reducing the number of required labels on a number of components!

posts.title: Docs updates
posts.content: We added a ton of Masonry documentation: an [updated docs page](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/masonry), a [README that explains how Masonry works internally](https://github.com/pinterest/gestalt/blob/master/packages/gestalt/src/Masonry/README.md), and [Pinboard-specific implementation details](https://pdocs.pinadmin.com/docs/webapp/masonry) (Pinployees only). We continued our migration to use the more reliable and beautiful Sandpack code editor, with 5 more docs pages converted. Unfortunately that code editor doesn't work with dev changes to components, so we added [a query param](https://github.com/pinterest/gestalt/pull/2992) that we can use when sharing links of dev builds. We revamped our [About Us](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/get_started/about_us) page. For Android, we added [IconButtonFloating](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/iconbuttonfloating) documentation and updated specs across a number of components. And we greatly expanded our [guidelines for data visualizations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/overview).

digests.summary: Update on Figma variables support.

posts.title: Gestalt + Figma variables update
posts.imageAltText: Figma variables symbol.
posts.content:
Figma variables were a hit during Config 2023, and we couldn’t be more excited to test it out on Gestalt’s libraries to improve your workflow by tokenizing design assets and creating semantic experiences!

We just added color and space variables to our Foundations library, which is being tested. So if you see them around, don’t worry; we will let you know when they are ready to make magic 🔮. Stay tuned for updates!

Tip: [Learn more about variables](https://youtu.be/1ONxxlJnvdM)

digests.summary: Big big updates with the addition of the TagData component and Card guidelines.

posts.title: New TagData component
posts.imageAltText: Example of TagData component.
posts.content: Fresh off the press is our new [TagData component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tagdata). TagData enables users to select multiple categories to compare with each other in a graph or chart. This component is going to be a helpful companion to our upcoming data visualization components.

posts.title: New Card component guidelines
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of the Card component documentation.
posts.content:
We wrapped up a big collaboration with the Browse team where we worked to unify the design and content of in-feed modules. This work resulted in finalized Card component/content designs along with [Card component guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/card/card) as well as guidelines for [Boards](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/card/card.boards) and [Pins](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/card/card.pins) preview blocks.

This work should enable a more unified and consistent experience when Pinners are presented with in-feed recommendations.

digests.summary: iOS in-app Gestalt tools, DefaultLabelProvider improvements, Figma library updates and a bunch of updates to our Figma plugin.

posts.title: iOS in-app color and icon browsers
posts.imageAltText: Screenshots of the iOS in-app color and icon browsers.
posts.content: We continue to build out the foundation of Gestalt for mobile. A nice step forward is the inclusion of our MVP color and icon browsers in the iOS pre-release mobile app builds. You can find both browsers in the Product Design Standards section of dev tools.

posts.title: DefaultLabelProvider improvements
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of DefaultLabelProvider code and example of how it renders.
posts.content: We greatly expanded the use of [DefaultLabelProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/utilities/defaultlabelprovider) by adding 26 new strings and updating 7 existing strings. We also cleaned up the Video component API so you no longer have to set up accessibility labels manually for mute, pause, play, and so on.

posts.title: Figma RadioGroup component improvements
posts.imageAltText: Example of Figma RadioGroup component.
posts.content: We continue to refine our Figma libraries with quality-of-life improvements. This week, we fixed up RadioGroup to be simpler and more consistent to use across all platforms.

posts.title: Pinterest Design plugin updates
posts.imageAltText: Promo picture of the Pinterest Design Figma plugin.
posts.content:
We've added a ton of improvements to our [Pinterest Design Figma plugin](https://www.figma.com/community/plugin/1215463263194174399). Here's a rundown of the highlights:
* Added a Re-Run button to the top of the Color Converter module so you don't have to navigate back to run again
 * Improved Color Converter success rate by linting and pre-autofixing some text and fill color styles
 * Now showing Pin title on hover in the Pinsert module Pin grid
 * Added empty search results text to the Pinsert module indicating when search is complete but yielded no results
* Now using the highest available Pin image resolution for fills
* Refined the logic for centering and zooming selections when inserting images

Many, many more improvements are coming, so we suggest giving it a go!

digests.summary: ActionBar component added to Figma libraries.

posts.title: Updated ActionBar Figma components
posts.imageAltText: Example of the Figma ActionBar component
posts.content:
Fresh off the press is our new Figma ActionBar component for Android, iOS and Web! Three things you need to know:

1. It's a “pilot” component, meaning we are still improving this component. Changes might occur in the future; so make sure to keep your files up to date with Gestalt updates, and you will be good to go! This component is only available on Figma at this moment.
2. ActionBar uses 48 px height elements. We plan to unify our SM Button and LG IconButton size from 44 to 48 in all platforms, to meet accessibility standards and improve the experience for the broadest range of Pinners. We have decided to maintain this height to clarify our long-term direction for this component.
3.

digests.summary: Major data visualization updates, significant Android docs improvements and advertising safe zone guidelines.

posts.title: Data visualization guidelines
posts.imageAltText: Illustration of data visualizations.
posts.content: We are beyond excited to share the release of our [expanded data visualization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/overview). These guidelines cover [charts and graphs](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/charts_and_graphs), [micro-visualizations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/micro_visualizations), [available components](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/available_components), [color palette](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/color/palette) and [color usage](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/data_visualization/color/usage). This was a major lift by the team and we're stoked it's available.

posts.title: Data visualization Figma components
posts.imageAltText: Screenshots of Figma bar chart component.
posts.content: We're not done on the topic of data visualization. We also added new data viz component to our Figma data viz library! In there you'll find bar charts, line charts, tiles and tags specifically for the purpose of (you guessed it) data visualization. This, along with our guidelines is going to set us up nicely to deliver code-backed React components in H2 of this year.

posts.title: Gobs of Android docs improvements
posts.imageAltText: The Android logo.
posts.content: Our team has been putting a lot of work expanding our mobile documentation. We recently published a major update so that all our Android component docs now include full design specs (including anatomy, token breakdowns, and variant details). As we continue active development of Android components, these updates should make that process smoother and awesomer.

posts.title: Advertising safe area
posts.imageAltText: An example of advertising safe zones added to the Figma Pin component.
posts.content: We've begun the introduction of defining advertising safe zones within the Pin component to ensure content is not occluded by UI. These specifications are currently only in our Figma Web Library, but we are actively discussing how we can make these guidelines more available across Pinterest.

posts.title: Gestalt Eng May Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from May.

posts.title: TileData
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of TileData UI
posts.content: Introducing our newest component, [TileData](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tiledata)! TileData enables users to select multiple categories to compare with each other in a graph or chart view, while still being able to see all of the data points. We plan to release more data viz components later this year — keep an eye on [our Roadmap page](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/roadmap) for updates!

posts.title: TypeScript declarations
posts.imageAltText: Decorative TypeScript logo with Seattle skyline
posts.content: We now include TypeScript declarations for `gestalt` and `gestalt-datepicker`! Long requested by internal tools folks, this means that you can use Gestalt in TypeScript projects without needing to install any additional packages. We added a `types` field to our `package.json` files, so that TypeScript projects can automatically find the declarations. While we don't have specific plans to migrate to TypeScript yet, this is a big step towards making TypeScript a first-class citizen in Gestalt.

posts.title: Mobile web adaptive components
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of mobile Dropdown UI
posts.content: As teased previously, we've started to roll out mobile-specific UI for certain components. Supported components will automatically adapt to the user's device type to show the preferred UI (though this can be overridden when needed). We've started with [Dropdown](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/dropdown) and [Modal](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/modal), and will continue to add more components over time. This means that for most UIs, you can use the same Gestalt components on both web and mobile, and they'll automatically `do the right thing`. This will bring a much more native feel to our mobile experience!

posts.title: Component updates: Dropdown.Link, Icon, List, OverlayPanel, PageHeader, PopoverEducational, SheetMobile, Status, Table.Row
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Status with `queued` status
posts.content: We added a [new lint rule](https://github.com/pinterest/gestalt/tree/master/packages/eslint-plugin-gestalt#gestaltprefer-list) to encourage [List](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/list) usage, which has already been enabled in Pinboard. [Status](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/status) now has a new `queued` status available. [PageHeader](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/pageheader) also now has a full complement of `badge` types available. [Table.Row](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/table#Table.Row) and related subcomponents gained two new props, `hoverStyle` and `selected`. [SheetMobile](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/sheetmobile) also got a new prop, `onOutsideClick`. We updated the icon used in [Dropdown.Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/dropdown#Dropdown.Link) for external links. [SheetMobile](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/sheetmobile) and [OverlayPanel](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/overlaypanel) got improved animations, and we fixed a bug with [PopoverEducational](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popovereducational)'s `zIndex` prop. Finally, pour one out (again!) for Google Plus — we finally removed the `google-plus` icon from [our icon library](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library).

posts.title: Docs updates
posts.content: We added and updated content for our Android ButtonGroup and TextField pages. We also continue to refactor web component pages using our old code editor to use Sandpack instead — two more this month!

digests.summary: New TileData component, updates to PageHeader, more Figma library updates and better documentation code examples.

posts.title: New TileData component
posts.imageAltText: Example of Gestalt's TileData component.
posts.content: Say hello [TileData](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/tiledata)! This component is part of our effort to provide greater support for data visualization within Gestalt. TileData is for selecting categories in a graph or chart. And we plan to ship graphs/charts within Gestalt the second half of this year.

posts.title: PageHeader badge update
posts.imageAltText: Gestalt PageHeader component with a success badge.
posts.content: We've increased the awesomosity of [PageHeader](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/pageheader) by enabling the title badge to be set to different types (like `success`). To see this in action, have a look at the [PageHeader title variant example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/pageheader#Title).

posts.title: Figma library updates
posts.imageAltText: Gestalt text displayed with line height called out.
posts.content:
We continue to make Figma library updates by the buckets. Here are the highlights:
* The line height for Android and iOS text styles were updated to more accurately reflect what’s in code
 * We implemented [simplified component instances](https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/5579474826519-Explore-component-properties#simplified) for our iOS and Android components
 * Lastly, we updated our mobile Contextual Menu component to be, well, an actual component. Sorry about that!

posts.title: Code example updates
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Gestalt example code.
posts.content: Our old documentation code samples have some issues - specifically around selecting text. We're fixing that by migrating our code examples to Sandpack. We just shipped shiny new examples for [Callout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/callout), which brings us close to 60% of components migrated over. We plan to keep this going by migrating [SlimBanner](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/slimbanner) and [Table](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/table) in the next couple weeks.

digests.summary: Improved search results, new Pin aspect ratios and Android icons in the Gestalt codebase

posts.title: Docs search improvements
posts.imageAltText: A search field with text entered that says, 'It works now'.
posts.content: We've dramatically improved the relevance of search results in our documentation. This has admittedly been an issue for some time and has been a frequently shared pain point by folks who use our documentation. We're super excited to say that our search improvements should alleviate a lot of those frustrations. We apologize it took so long to get this fix out, but we're so glad it's landed.

posts.title: Figma Pin component aspect ratios
posts.imageAltText: Example of the Pin Figma component and list of supported aspect ratios.
posts.content: We've added landscape Pin image aspect ratio variants to our Figma Android, iOS and Web libraries. Specifically, 16:9, 3:2 and 4:3. This enables better support for alternative ways Pins are displayed.

posts.title: Gestalt icons added for Android
posts.imageAltText: Thumbs up icon.
posts.content: We've added the full Gestalt icon set in Android format to our codebase. This is a _major_ step towards creating a centralized, unified, cross platform icon collection. Doing so will allow us to make macro-level visual iconography improvements across all platforms with near zero operational overhead. This is just the first step, but a big one.

digests.summary: Dropdown updates, smoother animations, new guidelines to help with design file hygiene, more Figma library updates and mobile documentation.

posts.title: Dropdown updates
posts.imageAltText: Examples of Dropdown in desktop and mobile web contexts.
posts.content:
Gestalt's Web Dropdown now is [mWeb adaptive](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/dropdown#Mobile). This is awesome because now using Dropdown will _just work_ in any situation. For desktop, the menu will display as a Popover and on mobile, it'll reveal as a Sheet. This means just one less thing for you to do when building experiences. So make sure to treat yourself to something nice with all the extra time you now have

**Note:** Dropdown mobile adaptation is not set as default yet. We are still improving SheetMobile to support additional functionality. Once the refinements are finished, we'll set mobile adaptation to SheetMobile as default.

We also switched out the link affordance to our new standard `visit` icon. This will ensure greater visual continuity throughout the product.

posts.title: Animation improvements for Sheet and OverlayPanel
posts.content: We implemented `window.requestAnimationFrame` to [SheetMobile](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/sheetmobile) and [OverlayPanel](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/overlaypanel) so our browsers can be smarter and more performant managing the animations in these components. This means silkier and smooth-ier in-product transitions.

posts.title: Design hygiene guidelines
posts.content:
Keeping our design files clean and organized is one of those unspoken, yet absolutely critical things to help maintain focus and flow. We've put together a set of guidelines to help ensure we're all keeping our files clear and tidy. These guidelines include [naming conventions](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/team_support/design_file_hygiene/naming_convention), [organizing layout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/team_support/design_file_hygiene/organizing_layout), [Figma branches](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/team_support/design_file_hygiene/figma_branches) and last but _definitely not least_, [design handoff](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/team_support/design_file_hygiene/design_handoff).

We are really hopeful these guidelines will help everyone's day to day work and would love your feedback on this!

posts.title: Figma library updates
posts.content:
It seems like every week comes with a bunch of Figma library updates and this week is no exception.

* We are super excited to share that we've implemented [simplified component instances](https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/5579474826519-Explore-component-properties#simplified) in most of the Figma web library components. This update means only editable layers for our components are visible in the layers panel. We started with Web to get your feedback and plan to roll out to all libraries once we hear your feedback. 

* We also have a new component on the web Figma library: our trusty List component. Using List will ensure that you're following the standard spacing and bullets used for our React components.

* Lastly, we added disabled variants to the Android and iOS Switch components.

posts.title: ButtonGroup Android docs
posts.content: Lastly, we've added component docs for [Android ButtonGroup](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/buttongroup). This is our first step towards getting this component built and available in the Android codebase.

digests.summary: Official TypeScript support, mweb-adaptive Dropdowns, TextField Android docs and boatloads of Figma library updates.

posts.title: Official TypeScript declarations
posts.imageAltText: Gestalt and TypeScript logos.
posts.content: This is a big, _big_ update. Gestalt now officially supports TypeScript as of v111.0.0. Gestalt will also now maintain TS types internally. With that said, this is an initial release, so if you run into any incorrect types, please reach out to #gestalt-eng-web or send us a PR with a fix!

posts.title: TextField Android docs
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of TextField's Android docs.
posts.content: The team published design specs for our [Android TextField component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/textfield). We're now up to 13 Android component docs as of this month, which is a major accomplishment for the team.

posts.title: Figma library updates
posts.imageAltText: Examples of Tag, Tabs, AvatarGroup and Modal components.
posts.content:
We have a boatload of Figma library updates:
* Image fills for all components across all libraries now use our imagery styles from our Foundations library.
* We made numerous improvements to our Modal and Sheet Figma components across all platforms to more closely represent Gestalt's current specs and guidelines.
* The Tabs component now can display a numeric indicator.
* We added a missing warning variant to the Tag component in our Web library.

posts.title: Gestalt Eng April Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from April.

posts.title: SheetMobile
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of SheetMobile UI
posts.content: Remember when we renamed Sheet to OverlayPanel? Here's why: introducing our new mobile-only component, [SheetMobile](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/sheetmobile)! This mweb-specific component is a generic container for a variety of content. It animates up from the bottom of the screen, and back down when dismissed. You can use this component to create mweb experiences with a more native feel. But don't go too crazy with it yet — we plan to make several of our existing components "adaptive" on mobile, automatically switching to use this new UI instead. Also this component is still in pilot, so expect possible breaking changes in the near future.

posts.title: DateField
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of DateField UI
posts.content: We recently released an experimental new component, [DateField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datefield)! Built to help support Project Protect, this component allows the user to easily input a date using only the keyboard. Keep in mind that this component is experimental, and may see breaking changes in the near future.

posts.title: Component updates: DatePicker, IconButtonFloating, NumberField, Popover, Table, TextField, TextField, TextArea
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of DatePicker UI with month and year dropdowns
posts.content: [DatePicker](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datepicker) now supports dropdowns for "month" and "year" for faster date selection. [TextField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textfield) nows allows specification of the input mode, and along with [NumberField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/numberfield) has mobile-only props indicated by a prefix, like `mobileEnterKeyHint` and `mobileInputMode`. [TextArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textarea) now uses its existing `rows` prop to indicate both the minimum and the maximum number of rows shown, with scrollable overflow. [Table](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/table) saw a couple of changes: headers and footers now have a border, and Table.RowExpanded can be used in a controlled manner using the `expanded` prop. We also added a number of icons: `briefcase`, `sun`, and `moon` on web; and `arrow-circle-back`, `add-section`, `briefcase`, `move-pin`, and `workflow-queued` on Android. Finally, we've been upgrading Flow versions and are nearly at the most current version. This will greatly increase type safety for all our components!

posts.title: Docs updates
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of code example UI showing new dark mode and text direction buttons
posts.content: You can now toggle dark mode and text direction for each code example! No need to change settings for the entire site just for one example. [Toast](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/toast) and [TextArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/textarea) for Android both saw updates, as did [Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/text) on iOS. And we converted 3 more web component pages to use Sandpack for code examples.

posts.title: Shoutouts
posts.content: Special shoutout to Yen-Wei Liu for a change to how we handle sourcemaps, leading to ~50% bundle size decrease!

digests.summary: New SheetMobile and DateField Web components, various docs additions/improvements, a new alpha release pipeline and new Figma components.

posts.title: New SheetMobile component (pilot version)
posts.imageAltText: Example of Gestalt's SheetMobile component.
posts.content: We've shipped a pilot version of our [SheetMobile component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/sheetmobile). This represents one of our highest priorities for H1, so we're super excited for this initial launch. We're still working on some kinks, but it's well on its way to being ready to use. We look forward to having more updates on this topic.

posts.title: New DateField component (experimental version)
posts.imageAltText: Example of Gestalt's DateField component.
posts.content: We shipped an experimental [DateField component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datefield) to address a pressing need within product. This component also has some kinks to iron out, but we felt it was ready to ship in an experimental state. This was a great team effort to get a workable solution out the door in such a short time, so big congrats to all involved!

posts.title: Alpha release pipeline
posts.imageAltText: Greek alpha symbol.
posts.content:
We're super excited to announce that we've implemented an alpha release pipeline for Gestalt. This means we'll be able to ship new/improved features to Gestalt much sooner through alpha releases.

Want to learn more about this? Of course you do! We've added an [alpha releases guide](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/get_started/developers/releases#Alpha-releases) to our docs just for you.

posts.title: Mobile docs updates
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Gestalt's iOS Text documentation.
posts.content:
Our mobile documentation continues to grow at a steady pace. We recently added the following component docs:
* [Android Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/text)
 * [Android TextArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/android/textarea)
* [iOS Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/ios/text)

There's more where this came from, so stay tuned.

posts.title: Dark mode and RTL for component code examples
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of the Gestalt Button component example in dark mode.
posts.content: Sometimes you just need to see how a component example looks in RTL and/or dark mode. Well, now our component examples have toggles for dark mode and RTL. No more fiddling with site-wide settings!

posts.title: New TagData and TableOfContents Figma components
posts.imageAltText: Example of the TagData Figma component.
posts.content:
The M10n component train keeps chugging with the addition of two M10n-centric Figma components. First is TagData which is a Tag component specifically made for the context of data visualizations. You can find this component in our Data viz Figma component library.

The other component is our new TableOfContents, which is used to navigate to anchors on a page. It also serves as an outline of a page’s content. TableOfContents is available for use in our Figma Web library.

digests.summary: Updates related to date/number entry, new unauth Figma components, Table enhancements and additional color tokens.

posts.title: mobileInputMode and mobileEnterKeyHint options for TextField and NumberField
posts.imageAltText: Example of decimal keypad for TextField.
posts.content:
[TextField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textfield) and [NumberField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/numberfield) got two helpful mobile enhancements. `mobileInputMode` allows you to specify the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. This allows mobile browsers to display an appropriate virtual keyboard.

`mobileEnterKeyHint` allows to you specify the action label to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards.

You can see examples of these props in our [Mobile Textfield examples](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textfield#Mobile).

posts.title: Year/Month dropdown options to DatePicker
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of DatePicker component.
posts.content: We shipped a less-than-perfect, yet better-than-nothing update to DatePicker for [simpler date selection on mobile devices](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/datepicker#selectLists). This variant will allow for a much simpler date selection experience on mobile devices. We hope to refine this variant further in future sprints.

posts.title: New Figma OverlayUpsell component and Feedcard variant
posts.imageAltText: Screenshots of OverlayUpsell and FeedCard Figma components.
posts.content:
We're super excited to share that we just shipped two nice updates to our Web Figma library made specifically for unauth experiences. We've created a new OverlayUpsell component to display short messages when users have performed actions that indicate some intent, such as a related pin tap or idea pin swipe.

We also shipped a new variant of FeedCard that displays a simple background color for simple in-feed messages.

posts.title: Table enhancements
posts.imageAltText: Example of Table with sticky header and footer.
posts.content:
Table saw two nice updates this week. First we implement a [controlled Table.RowExpanded with expanded prop](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/table#ControlledUncontrolled-Table.RowExpandable). This allows rows to be expanded without user direct input.

We also shipped a visual refinement to [Table's sticky footer](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/table#Sticky-header-and-footer) to include a drop shadow for greater visual clarity.

posts.title: Text subtle update
posts.imageAltText: Examples of new subtle gray color options.
posts.content:
We updated our subtle color value to be lighter, and added a disabled color for inactive text/icons needs! Also, we added a subtle-accent value to support text over lightGray contrast needs.

Please note: This update is only available on Figma at the moment. We will update our tokens/docs soon. Stay tuned!

posts.title: Gestalt Eng March Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from March.

posts.title: HelpButton
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of HelpButton UI
posts.content: Introducing our newest component, [HelpButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/helpbutton)! This component used alongside another UI element to help explain the element to the user.

posts.title: OverlayPanel.DismissingElement
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of OverlayPanel.DismissingElement UI
posts.content: We re-architected how animation works in OverlayPanel (formerly known as "Sheet"), abstracting it to a new subcomponent: [OverlayPanel.DismissingElement](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/overlaypanel#DismissingElement). This simplifies implementation of closing animations and will be useful in other components in the future.

posts.title: Component updates: Button, Dropdown, Icon, IconButton, IconButtonFloating, Masonry, ModalAlert, Pog, Popover
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of new icons added
posts.content: We removed [Masonry's](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/masonry) deprecated `Item` prop — you should now be using `renderItem` instead. [Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/button) and [ModalAlert](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/modalalert) now have `dataTestId`s. [Dropdown](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/dropdown) has a new `maxHeight` prop that can help address visual bugs with long lists of items. We fixed a right-to-left (RTL) bug with [Pog](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/pog) and [IconButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbutton) that caused some icons to disappear on iPhone (it was [a fun one-liner](https://github.com/pinterest/gestalt/pull/2730) 😅). [IconButtonFloating](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbuttonfloating) got a few new props, which you'll recognize from IconButton: `disabled`, `dangerouslySetSvgPath`, and (required!) `tooltip`. We removed [Popover's](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popover) `'orange'` `color` option. And finally we added [four new icons](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/foundations/iconography/library): `add-section`, `arrow-circle-back`, `move-pin`, and `workflow-status-queued`.

posts.title: Docs updates

posts.content: We added a number of new pages this month! [Team Support](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/team_support/overview) includes resources and guidelines for collaborating with us. Finally, we converted 12 existing web component pages to use our new Sandpack inline code editor.

posts.title: Update to Web Toast and Badge components

posts.content:
We're excited to announce that we've officially shipped our updates for [Toast](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/toast) and [Badge](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/badge) on Web.

 We've dramatically slimmed down Toast to create a smaller footprint on the screen for less occlusion. We're hoping this enables Toasts to give Pinners helpful updates while staying out of the way.

 On the other side, we've increased the size of Badge to assist with legibility. We've also included the ability to add a tooltip to allow you to add context. 

 The updated Badge is already available to use in our Figma components and Toast is not far behind.

posts.title: Component updates: Box, Button, Flex, IconButton, Image, Link, TapArea, Popover
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Popover with dismiss button
posts.content:
[Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/button#rel-and-target), [IconButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbutton#Role), [Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/link#Target), and [TapArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/taparea) have improved accessibility for screen readers when opening in a new tab/window, providing the user with necessary context to understand the element's behavior. [Image](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/image) now passes through the `event` object in `onLoad` and `onError` to allow for more precise responses to these events. We replaced Image's `importance` prop with `fetchPriority` for use in performance tweaks in Chromium-based browsers. Image also now always outputs `` — previously it would output a `
` when the image was scaled, as a hack to support IE11. [Popover](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/popover#Dismiss-button) has a new prop, `showDismissButton`, to give users an obvious affordance to close the element. posts.title: New components: ModalAlert and DefaultLabelProvider
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of ModalAlert
posts.content:
We released two new components: ModalAlert and DefaultLabelProvider.

[ModalAlert](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/modalalert) is a focused, simple alert dialog that fulfills one of the most common modal usages in a much simpler way than our Modal component. Check it out, and look for other focused user messaging components in the near future.

You probably won't need to interact directly with [DefaultLabelProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/utilities/defaultlabelprovider) much, unless you maintain a repo using Gestalt. It's an root-level Provider that supplies default values for common labels, like ModalAlert's `accessibilityDismissButtonLabel`. This means fewer props are required at the component callsite, making implementation faster and easier. Apps that require translations, like Pinboard, can pass those in [where DefaultLabelProvider is implemented](https://phabricator.pinadmin.com/diffusion/P/browse/master/webapp/app/packages/gestaltExtensions/GestaltDefaultLabelProvider.js). Apps that do not require translations can implement the Provider with no additional work needed, getting the labels for free!

posts.title: Gestalt Eng September Newsletter
posts.content: A recap of significant changes from September.

posts.title: TextField / TextArea max length
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of TextField / TextArea max length
posts.content: TextField and TextArea now support a `maxLength` prop to allow for communication and enforcement of character limits for user input. [Check out the docs](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/textfield#Maximum-length) for more details on how to use this new feature.

posts.title: SelectList groups
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of SelectList groups
posts.content: SelectList now supports grouping of items with a revamped API using two sub-components, SelectList.Option and SelectList.Group. This allows for more complex dropdown menus without needing to create a more custom experience using Dropdown, improving mobile support and accessibility. [Check out the docs](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/selectlist#Groups) to learn more about these new sub-components.

posts.title: Device-specific UI
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of mobile SideNavigation UI
posts.content: Earlier this year we quietly introduced a Context Provider to allow Gestalt components to use specific UI based on the user's device type (desktop vs mobile). With the launch of SideNavigation last month, [we're making this Provider public](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/utilities/devicetypeprovider). Expect to see more updates in the future for device-specific UI in Gestalt components!

posts.title: Component updates: Checkbox, IconButton, RadioGroup, TextField
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of Checkbox
posts.content: We standardized the style and props used for helper text and error messages on [Checkbox](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/checkbox#With-helperText) and [RadioGroup](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/radiogroup#With-helperText) to match TextField, for a more consistent UI and developer experience (DX). We also improved DX by updating [IconButton's default size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbutton#IconButtonProps) to match design guidance, for one fewer prop that needs to be set in the default usage. Badge now supports a [new 'recommendation' type](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/badge#Type). And we [improved security for the end user](https://www.androidpolice.com/google-chrome-servers-get-passwords-enhanced-spell-check/) by turning off autocomplete for all TextFields of type `'password'` or `'email'`. Special thanks to Brian Lee for the heads-up on that fix!

posts.title: Docs updates
posts.imageAltText: Screenshot of button to copy Flow type
posts.content:
When creating wrapper components that pass props through to Gestalt components, what Flow type should you use? Copy/pasting types from Gestalt source misses any future updates, leading to stale types. Reaching into Gestalt internals isn't allowed or recommended, as those types are subject to breaking changes without warning. Thankfully Flow provides utility types for this situation: `$ElementType<React$ElementConfig<typeof ComponentName>, 'propName'>`. Since this syntax isn't easy to remember, we added [a note in our FAQ](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/get_started/faq#Component-usage) as well as a button that appears next to every prop in the Props tables that will copy the correct syntax to your clipboard.

We also updated the code examples for Avatar, AvatarGroup, Box, Button, ComboBox, Flex, and IconButton to use the new Sandpack editor.

posts.title: New iOS Figma library structure
posts.imageAltText: iOS library cover art
posts.content:
We've been listening to designers' feedback and, by a large margin, there's a strong preference to add Gestalt components to design from the Assets panel or the new Resources popover. We've also excited to hear that designers' prefer to learn about how to use our components from our [documentation site](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/home). We're going all-in with this feedback to focus our libraries on a search-first experience while also removing the confusion regarding where to go to learn how to design with Gestalt. To do so, we're paring back our libraries to focus only on components/styles and removing non-essential pages/resources. This should make our libraries clearer and more focused on your desired workflow. It also has the added benefit of reducing the overall maintenance of these libraries, meaning we can focus our efforts on new/improve components, better documentation, etc.

We couldn't be more excited about this change. We _just_ rolled out this update for the iOS library and plan to apply the same changes to our Android and Web libraries in the weeks to come.

You'll start to see this in action on M10n product surfaces soon!

posts.title: Component updates: Flex, IconButton, Masonry
posts.imageAltText: Illustration of Flex/Masonry component
posts.content: We reworked [Flex's `gap` prop](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/flex#Gap) to support row and column spacing, making the component much more useful in situations where items could wrap to the next row or column. We adjusted [IconButton's default values](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/iconbutton) for `size` and `iconColor` to match design guidance, so you have less code to type for the default treatment. We also renamed [Masonry's `comp` prop to `Item`](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/masonry), to better communicate that the prop value needs to be a stable component reference. (We'll address this further with a lint rule in the near future.) And finally, [Masonry now supports RTL (right-to-left)!](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/web/masonry) In RTL layouts, Masonry's first item now appears in the top right, rather than the top left.
